author: miro.radenovic
title: NFT Platform for business cases
description: NFT solves many real-world scenarios for small and mid-size businesses but misses adoptions due to no UX/Tools that can facilitate usage.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer is offering an all inclusive website to build (mint), manage and sell non-fungible tokens targeted at businesses which could potentially bring new investors to the Cardano blockchain as well as provide services not found on many NFT Marketplaces today. With the goal to bring more businesses the option of real world use case and utility from their onsite NFT sources, Cardano is a solid platform of technology and community for this to solve a major problem facing the ecosystem today. With integrating more businesses that may not understand the potential of blockchain technology or NFTs, this would be an excellent way to introduce them to what Cardano has to offer. The proposal's solution could potentially add a massive amount of new users and value to the ecosystem while maintaining a safe and secure way for businesses and personal creations alike to succeed in a uniformed fashion given a 'One Stop Shop' presented in a user friendly way in order to build quality NFTs that participants can benefit in real world applications. Many NFT marketplaces today do offer trading and royalties for certified projects who register via the blockchain through policy Identifications. This proposer is offering a streamlined experience through massive backend development to ensure a seamless minting process for businesses. Having a payment option that doesn't involve the blockchain initially is a great way for new users to feel more comfortable, using credit card applications to make and receive payments will be similar to Crypto.com and it's NFT marketplace, as well as enable ADA holders the option to buy and sell using their crypto assets. This alone could eventually bring more adoption to the Cardano ecosystem as well as introduce more users to the NFT space as a whole.
f6_assessments.q1: The timeline in which the proposer has presented could be a great indicator to what the team is capable of performing. After further review of the team's website linked here https://dev4side.com and LinkedIn reference pages, the talent within such a vast network is promising in order to achieve such a task proposed, much like Cardano itself. The milestones ahead are clearly sited and given weekly appropriate windows to perform all tasks involved. It is not my opinion on how much these milestones should cost, but given the amount of time spent on each one, a detailed breakdown of cost could help in assessing the amounts given to each (in regard to Milestones 2-5 where most of the funding will be allocated towards). This in particular in reference to what a reasonable budget should look like. Additional funding sited through the company's reserves will assist in achieving the 7 month proposal period. In the events that some of these milestones have any set backs, is there any considerable changes to the budget that could occur? It is stated that additional funds may be in need for future marketing, but the proposer states clearly that a quality product that is fully functional to be delivered to the customer is of the utmost importance. This in turn is critical within the ever changing ecosystem of Cardano as with the crypto markets, having something that works without fail is crucial in the community as well as building a solid platform for new users to feel safe while either tip toeing into NFTs or diving into without any cause for concern.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposer has fully understood the meaning of Auditability by offering full transparency throughout the project's progress. With use through public access to weekly updates of what's being built on the platform, as well as "changelogs" to verify the accomplished milestones are being met on time, it is promised by the proposer each advancement within the timeline will be viewable by PC with assistance from Azure DevOps and Agile Software Development methods. The biggest problems to resolve the solution will depend mostly on backend developments, and these targeted problems shall be well documented and described within the weekly reports so that continued success of the proposal is met on time. Having a fully functioning web application that allows the features proposed, would greatly increase the user base for Cardano, not only in NFT volume but for businesses who are willing to take a leap into new, perhaps often, unknown territory still waiting to be explored. In regards to functionality, based on other NFT sites who offer less options, it may be beneficial to note updates to the web application after fully operational will most definitely be needed if exponential traffic takes place. As available NFT marketplaces have experienced time and time again, the amount of volume from the Cardano community and other crypto based non-fungible token enthusiasts should not be underestimated. Expect higher than your expectations.

f6_assessments.q0:
If you want to drive mass adoption of Cardano, it is paramount to bring real value to the ecosystem. One of the best ways to do this is to attract business customers, as they bring a user base.

This is exactly what the proposal is trying to solve. Should the team succeed in building the easy to use platform they describe, it could offer great potential for Cardano! 

The NFT market will continue to evolve and the proposal is, in my opinion, heading in exactly the right direction.
f6_assessments.q1:
The members of the team are not beginners, but have been working in the field of development of innovative applications for a long time. This allows them to plan complex problems skillfully. In addition, they have various tools that accelerate the process already at hand. The necessary skills and know-how are already available.

The team has already correctly analyzed various risks and taken them into account. Although the team has not yet programmed in Haskell, they have assigned one of the engineers to do so. It should be absolutely possible for a software company to learn the relevant skills in a short time frame.

The team details the costs and provides 160000 dollars themselves. This shows that they take the project very seriously and are willing to invest significant resources. 

The planning of the project is flawless!
f6_assessments.q2:
The extremely precise milestone and schedule makes it very easy for the community to track the progress of the project. The team plans to disclose all steps and methods and give weekly updates. This allows the progress to be accurately verified!

The goals of the project are ambitious, but are right within the team's reach.

f6_assessments.q0:
This project has a lot of potential and considering the proposer is a software company only improves the likelihood of success. As pointed out in the proposal most companies don’t want to be the so call ginny pig when it comes to implementing new technologies and to an extent because of the cost, uncertainty, and other unknown factors. I feel that is where projects like this help to bridge the gap by creating tools that can effectively address those adoption challenges. Anything that helps to make the transition smoother is good for the ecosystem because we want to quickly move away from an asset that is only used for gambling and one that has real-world utility. 
It's my opinion that this sort of project is great for the Cardano community and ecosystem and should be supported. That said, I was hoping to glean a bit of information on the ability to scale to address future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1: The feasibility key metrics all appear to have been met and documented as such. The proposer provided links to relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal. The team was broken down in an identifiable manner. The budgetary breakdown seems to have been correctly allocated and appears to be reasonable for a project of its scope. I think this proposal has the potential to be very successful and should receive our support.
f6_assessments.q2: It’s great that the proposer made statements of open transparency and open access to the test net and other documents. Additionally, there is a clearly delineated timeline with monthly milestones which would allow community members to adequately measure the project progress. I think this project has all the boxes checked for Clarity/audibility will be a great addition to the ecosystem.

f6_assessments.q0:
Very valid problem stament and the solution does addresses it, simplifying the way NFT are created and implemented, making it more accessible and personalized to companies.
It also is aligned with challenge, increasing challenge indicators as "NFT marketplace or facilitator"  and "Solutions utilising the power of smart contracts" at the same time it increases cardano adoption.

I particularly liked the examples provided, which helps to understand how solution will help small business. Risk and challenges parts are also well strucutred with good risks mapped and a mitigation plan. the guided step-by-step user experience to instruct users will be much welcomed. It would be also imporant to add direct channels for companies to get in touch with NFT platform PR team and have their questions, doubts and insercurities clarified (as in a bank or other business, where clients get in touch with their account managers). This helps to build trust on the solution which seems to be key in this project.

Another extra suggestion to the proposal will be include here how they intend to advertise their product to target businesses (and where will they target: any economic sector? any country? maybe for a more effective communication, some target audicence could be limited at first).
Moreover, a bit more information on business case could also be provided here. I mean, whey they intend to become self-sustainable (and generate profit) and how would the companies be charged by their service (business model)? This would help to assess economical viability.

Finally, webiste provided is good and provides some extra information about the company and the product.

All in all, I think it is a great idea and a well written proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
There's a clear time-framed roadmap with deliverables, milestones and resource listed. It is indeed very complete. The budget breakdown is embeded in the roadmap and broken by milestone, which makes sense and helps to give transparecy. it is also stated that the all budget in the timeline is to pay human resources and there's also some money for infrastrucutre and marketing, which is very good and clear. Part of the total project budget will be funded by the own company reserve which somehow show their confidence in the success of the product.

the team is already committed (5 people) and has capabilities and exeperience in software development and digital marketing, key areas to successfully deliver this product.

In general, the project seems well managed with capable and prepared people to sucessfully run it.
f6_assessments.q2:
It is possible to extract the milestones and deliverables from roadmap all data about the software will be opened to public, as it says in auditability part. The agile approach  that will be adopted also makes it easier to assess sprint reports and evolution and audit the project progress as a whole (not only the product itself).
As the scope of the proposal is not yet go to market, its hard to set kpis. At this point, the milestones, sprint reports and software and their changelogs, as proposed, should be enough to audit project in all of its dimentions.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal is for funding an NFT platform built on Cardano specifically aimed at business customers and satisfying their needs. While the Cardano NFT scene may seem like it's already vibrant, in truth we are only scratching the surface of what we could see in terms of adoption in the next few years. The team behind this proposal seems competent and qualified as they have already built a very nice presentation website for their solution and from the merger of their qualifications and their goals and the result could be very impactful for the Cardano ecosystem.

The main risks to a successful implementation of this project are properly identified by the team and addressed sufficiently. For instance they mention that even though they don't have a developer proficient in Haskell/Plutus, as of now they do have developers with functional programming experience and have started training in Plutus.
f6_assessments.q1:
The roadmap is presented in a very detailed fashion. Everything makes sense and the deliverables and the resources required to complete each milestone are clearly described.

The budget is broken down in detail and seems feasible given the scope of the proposal. The team also mention that they will fund a large portion of it themselves from their own company’s reserves (an amount estimated to be more than half of the total cost of the project).

Given that the team is made up of an already very experienced software development house the likelihood of successfully completing the proposed project should be very high. The credentials provided and the links to their professional public profile all check out.
f6_assessments.q2:
I would have liked to see a bit more emphasis on the project KPIs, however, other than that everything is presented clearly. The definitions of success are easy to follow and understand; the process for reporting on progress that is presented by the team should provide an easy way for the Catalyst auditing community to verify their claims.

In the future, or in case the proposal needs to be resubmitted, I would advise the team to break down the definitions of success by timeframes, for example, 3, 6, and 12 months.

solution: All-in-one web application to build, sell, track, verify and provide real case NFTs utilities for different business cases.
experience: Our team is part of Dev4Side Software an Italian company that has built 200+ software projects for worldwide enterprises. We've launched successful projects, by managing internally the development, marketing, and sales. Our projects become financially sustainable within 1-2 years
